question: I applied for health coverage through Pennie and they said I was potentially eligible for Medicaid.  I just now received a letter saying I was found ineligible for Medicaid and I was being sent back to Pennie. Am I not eligible for health coverage?
text:
I applied for health coverage through Pennie and they said I was potentially eligible for Medicaid.  I just now received a letter saying I was found ineligible for Medicaid and I was being sent back to Pennie. Am I not eligible for health coverage?
          
        
Individuals who applied for healthcare coverage through Pennieandwereassessed as potentially eligible forMedicaid (calledMedical Assistancein PA)by Pennie butwere thendetermined ineligible for Medical Assistanceby the Department of Human Services will be sent back to Pennie for enrollment inhealthcarecoverage.
If the information used to determine Medical Assistanceeligibility is correct, the individual should work with Pennie to pursue healthcare coverage options available to them.If the individual disagrees with the Medical Assistanceeligibility determinationand believesthe County Assistance Office made a mistake,the individual has theoption to appeal theMedical Assistanceeligibility determination.
Dont worry! Pennie is still available to help you shop for a great plan  high quality health coverage that is affordable and meets the healthcare needs of you and your family. While you may not be eligible for Medical Assistance, you may still qualify for financial assistance to lower the cost of health coverage and care by enrolling coverage through Pennie.
A Pennie Customer Service Representative can help with guidance and direction as well as application support by calling 1-844-844-8040. You can also access local help available in your area at 
pennie.com
.
